intro: [WRONG START] Boronia multiflora, commonly known as the coastal borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Borbonia multiflora is well adapted to salty coastal environments and is often used in coastal landscaping.
